divs: Sighting DetailsI was standing alone at the bus stop at 8:45 a.m. looking in a southeasterly direction when I spotted a silver sphere streak through the sky at an estimated distance of half a mile and several hundred feet off the ground. The object was observed for a brief 2-3 seconds at a 45 degree angle from the horizon and traveling in a clear blue sky. It was the size of a dime held at arms length and heading in the direction of Alexandria, VA and the Potomac River. It���s flight path from behind me would have had it traveling over the Pentagon. It reflected the sun���s light, and traveled about the same speed that a falling star would be traveling; there was no sound and it simply vanished in flight, not just disappearing over the horizon. I hadn���t planned on reporting this except that it seemed very similar to the silver-colored sphere described in case 22347 one hour later in Pennsylvania.
Summary: Silver Sphere Seen in Nothern Virginia
